definition[0]: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down
example[0]: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute  (=established by law).
definition[1]: a formal rule of an institution or organization
example[1]: College statutes forbid drinking on campus.
example[2]: He never violated any criminal statutes.
example[3]: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute.
definition[2]: a real or imaginary written collection of the laws in existence
example[4]: The government would like to see this new law on the statute book as soon as possible.
